>From: "korosh_afshar" <korosh_afshar@...>
>
>what is the best way to simulate socket connections from multiple
>clients, i.e.  different ip's and ports, with unit testing?
>
>I have some code that disallows connections if multiple socket
>connections are comming from the same client ip within a time
>interval and to properly test it I need to simulate multiple access
>from different ip's.

Well, how do you know which IP address originates the request and at what 
time? Suppose that there were an object that represented just this 
information:

class SocketConnectionInfo {
    Date connectionTime;
    IPAddress originatingAddress;

    boolean isConnectionFromSameAddressTooSoon(SocketConnectionInfo 
anotherConnection);
}

Now the code that disallows connections can talk to instances of this class. 
You can simply bombard your code with SocketConnectionInfo objects and see 
how it reacts to different sequences of them. This simulates the 
connections.

Finally, write code that creates a SocketConnectionInfo object for each 
incoming socket connection.

I know nothing about sockets, so this is just the first idea that comes to 
mind. Would it work?
